stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.

Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.

stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

preGame:
Greetings, sports fans, and welcome to a gorgeous, blood-soaked Tuesday night in the Losers Bracket! It‚Äôs your favorite voice of the void, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Prismatic Pavilion! üèüÔ∏è The air is thick with the smell of funnel cake, salt water, and the impending doom of a Best of 3 series! We‚Äôve got the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres hosting the Tortell Privateers, and let me tell you, the desperation in this stadium is more delicious than a soul-shard sundae! üç¶

Down on the field, the rituals are in full swing! I just saw the Privateers' Castorina Gies bribing a local oracle with a meat pie. I hope that oracle told him to duck, because the Bizarres look hungry! Speaking of the Bizarres, Gagliano Tallbott is currently telling a knock-knock joke to the Trollball itself. ü§° Whether the ball laughs or not, we‚Äôre in for a spectacle! This stadium is built on stilts over the lagoon, and I‚Äôm personally hoping to see some 'heroes' like that ringleader Kython take a tumble into the drink! 

The Tortell crowd is out in force tonight, clearly hoping their Privateers can pillage a win on the road. The atmosphere is electric, the footing is unstable, and the violence is guaranteed! Grab your grog, place your bets with someone other than Yarp‚ÄîI don't trust his odds‚Äîand let‚Äôs get ready for some TROLLBALL! üèàüíÄ
postGame:
Holy smokes, what a display of absolute carnage we just witnessed! Game 1 of this series is in the books, and the Tortell Privateers have drawn first blood‚Äîliterally and figuratively! ü©∏ The final score stands at 2 to 0 in favor of the Privateers, but the scoreboard doesn't even begin to tell the tale of the carnage on this unstable Prismatic Pavilion! üèüÔ∏è

Right out of the gate, Loralee Sunny scooped up the head in Center Field, but the real star of the opening act was Ellan Elburt! He didn't just play the game; he dismantled it by absolutely leveling Milo Nelie! Poor Milo was sent to the sidelines before the first whistle had even cooled down! üè•

But Elburt wasn't finished! He took aim from Home Field and sent that leathery troll head sailing through the goal for a magnificent 2-point Shoot! üéØ That‚Äôs the kind of precision that makes a demon weep with joy! The Privateers were running circles around the Bizarres, who seemed more distracted by the lagoon splashes than the game!

We saw Melisande Eustacia and Keisling Damalas trying to push the tempo, but the Bizarres' defense held firm for a moment, even if they couldn't find the ball themselves. Gagliano Tallbott was busy trying to tackle Kidder Starkey, but Starkey stood his ground like a fortress! üè∞

Just when you thought the Bizarres might mount a comeback before the half, Kristin Kronfeld managed to snag the ball, but the momentum was as shaky as the stage-planks beneath their feet! Halftime came just in time for the healers to patch up the holes in the rosters! ü©π

In the second half, the violence reached a fever pitch! Lilithe Royce was making a daring run for the goal when she was absolutely flattened by Quintessa Austine! But don't feel too bad for Lilithe, because the Privateers got their revenge when Melisande Eustacia turned the tables and sent Austine to the dirt! üëä

And let's talk about Milo Nelie. The poor soul returned to the field only to be targeted by Castorina Gies! Gies delivered a tackle so fierce it sent Milo right back to see Healer Essa Pattie for the second time tonight! Talk about a rough day at the office! üöë

The Bizarres tried to find their rhythm, with Demp Chet even managing to gain possession late, but the clock was their worst enemy. The 'heroes' of the Prismatic Troupe probably should have spent less time on their theatrical poses and more time on their blocking drills! üé≠

I haven't seen this much uncoordinated stumbling since the last time I saw Sir Garon Ironrock trying to navigate a particularly tricky door! The Privateers played like they had something to prove, and they certainly proved they can handle the pressure of the Losers Bracket! üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

So, the Tortell Privateers take a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series! The Bizarres have their backs against the lagoon now. If they don't find a way to score in Game 2, they'll be packing their greasepaint and heading home early! üé™

What a night! What a match! The Privateers leave with the win, and the Bizarres leave with enough bruises to paint a rainbow! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a night of beautiful, chaotic Trollball! Stay brutal, Osterra! üíÄ‚ú®
